C

calculateTrails() - Method in class lawnlayer.Trail
Called every 10 frames (to ensure any trails are produced only once the player is perfectly on a tile), this method holds the main logic behind appending green tiles behind the player.
checkOppositionAt(Material[][], int) - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
A method which allows which allows Enemy.checkReflections() to be written more succinctly; checks whether all 3 corner pieces are concrete or grass.
checkReflections() - Method in class lawnlayer.Beetle
Override abstract method in lawnlayer.Enemy; the Beetle enemy reflects off of grass and concrete but upon colliding with grass it transforms that grass tile back into soil.
checkReflections() - Method in class lawnlayer.Enemy
Based on the current direction of travel, this method controls an enemy's movement upon colliding with a wall or a grass tile.
checkReflections() - Method in class lawnlayer.Worm
Override abstract method in lawnlayer.Enemy; the Worm enemy simply reflects off grass and concrete while making no changes to the map.
checkReflectivityAt(Material[][], int) - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
A small method which allows Enemy.checkReflections() to be written more succinctly; essentially checks whether the material is grass or concrete, both materials which enemies can reflect off.
chooseSpawnPoint() - Method in class lawnlayer.Powerup
Chooses a random soil tile for the powerup to spawn at.
concrete - Variable in class lawnlayer.App
 
configPath - Variable in class lawnlayer.App
 
createMaterialsMatrix(int[][][]) - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
Given an array of surrounding coordinates the method converts the array to a matrix containing the material on each tile.
currentLevel - Variable in class lawnlayer.App
 
currentLevelNumber - Variable in class lawnlayer.App

draw() - Method in class lawnlayer.Powerup
Places the powerup sprite image on the Level object at the random spawn point decided in chooseSpawnPoint().

getMaterialPixel(int, int) - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
Returns the material underneath a specific pixel coordinate (x, y).
getMaterialTilesTouched(Material, int, int) - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
Using a combination of getMaterialTilesTouched(), getNearestSurroundingCoords(), and createMaterialsMatrix(), this method returns the sprite coordinates of all the tiles surrounding (x, y) of a certain material.
getNearestSurroundingCoords(int, int) - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
Given a sprite coordinate (x, y), this method returns the MINIMUM coordinates to move to reach an adjacent tile.
getPercentageGrass() - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
 
getPreviousMaterial() - Method in class lawnlayer.Player
 
getSurroundingCoords(int, int) - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
Given a sprite coordinate (x, y), this method returns the sprite coordinates for all 8 surrounding tiles.

R

recursiveReplaceMaterial(int[], Material, Material) - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
A recursive flood-fill method to replace every tile of a specific material surrounding a certain tile with another material.
release() - Method in class lawnlayer.Player
 
renderLevel() - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
The primary method which runs the game, rendering each material and their PImage at the correct spot on PApplet and updating enemies every frame.
reset() - Method in class lawnlayer.Player
 
resetLevel() - Method in class lawnlayer.App
Re-renders the level from scratch (no green/red/grass tiles) and decrements the number of lives remaining for the player.
resetRenderCount() - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
 
returnMaterialTiles(Material) - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
Returns an ArrayList of all the coordinates in the map which are of type material.
rReplaceMaterialStored(int[], Material, Material) - Method in class lawnlayer.Level
Similar to recursiveReplaceMaterial(), except this time it also returns an array containing the coordinates of every tile the flood fill algorithm has reached.
